quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Team and Player
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, yankees. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Star Wars character is an immense, fur-covered warrior of great strength and loyalty, and a sophisticated being with exceptional skills in starship piloting and repairing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chewbacca

questions.question: Although his real name Georgios Kyriacos Panayiotou sounds Greek, he was born in London. He gained popularity with his band Wham!.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Michael

questions.question: George Lucas directed all episodes of the first trilogy of Star Wars.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What team defeated the New York Yankees in the 1960 World Series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pittsburgh Pirates

questions.question: What National League pitcher threw a perfect game against the New York Mets on Fathers day in 1964?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Bunning

questions.question: What player was widely regarded as the best left-handed pitcher in the American League before he was switched to playing the outfield?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babe Ruth

questions.question: Her career started in the 50s when she was only 18. She joined Ike Turners touring show as an 18-year-old backup vocalist. Her real name is Annie Mae Bullock.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tina Turner

questions.question: What city did the Baltimore Orioles play in before moving to Baltimore?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Louis Missouri

questions.question: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back, the second film of the Star Wars saga, won which Academy Award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Best sound

questions.question: In Episode IV A New Hope the droids R2-D2 and C-3PO, were sold to whom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Owen Lars

questions.question: What long time American League manager was known for wearing street clothes on the bench?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Connie Mack

questions.question: This team won its first World Series title in 1980.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Philadelphia Phillies

questions.question: In what year did the Dodgers move to Los Angeles breaking Brooklyns collective heart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1957

questions.question: What old time great player bragged of injuring and possibly killing a man who tried to mug him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ty Cobb

questions.question: In The Return of the Jedi, the burgundy-wearing people who accompany Emperor Palpatine are his bodyguards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Mummy and Stone
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, discovery. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: John Simon Ritchie was only 19 when his band, The Sex Pistols made it to the top.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sid Vicious

questions.question: The Amesbury Archer, an early Bronze Age man dating to around 2300 BC, was nicknamed the King of Stonehenge by the British press.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Ötzi the Iceman is a well-preserved natural mummy of a man who lived about 5300 years ago. It rivals an Egyptian mummy as the oldest known human mummy in the world. What is the name of the Egyptian mummy in question?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ginger

questions.question: Paul Hewson is the lead singer of a famous Irish band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bono

questions.question: Born Reginald Dwight, this person sang Candle in the Wind, which was originally dedicated to Marilyn Monroe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elton John

questions.question: Norma Jean was the blond craze of Hollywood in 1950s. She starred in Some Like it Hot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marilyn Monroe

questions.question: William Bailey was the frontman of the great rock band Guns and Roses.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Axl Rose

questions.question: In 1898, near Kensington, Minnesota, a farmer found a roughly rectangular piece of stone covered in runes (this is true). Scientists are still unable to translate any of the runes on it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: David Robert Jones was one of the main characters in the Labyrinth movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Bowie

questions.question: The Siberian Ice Maiden is a rare example of a single woman given a ceremonial burial in her wooden tomb. She was even accompanied by six horses.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Rosetta Stone was the key to deciphering Egyptian hieroglyphs. What kind of stone was it made of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Granite

questions.question: The Dead Sea Scrolls, an important archaeological discovery of the XX century, comprise about 850 ancient documents. Among the most important of the texts are the Isaiah Scroll, the earliest version of the Damascus Document and the Copper Scroll. Do you know what is listed in the Copper Scroll?

options.text: Secret places where gold, scrolls, and weapons are hidden

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Secret places where gold, scrolls, and weapons are hidden

questions.question: In 1826 Rev. William Buckland discovered Red Lady of Paviland - a human skeleton dyed in red ochre.  Where did he make his discovery?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wales

questions.question: James Jewell Osterberg, Jr. is famous as the father of punk rock. He appeared in The Crow: The City of Angels.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iggy Pop

questions.question: Farouk Bulsara was born in Zanzibar. He was the lead singer of  Queen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Freddie Mercury

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Study and Airplane
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, john, keratin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the monk and scientist, who laid the foundation for the study of genetics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mendel

questions.question: How many of each type of animal did Moses bring into the ark?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 0

questions.question: Counting those of Guam, Puerto Rico, Washington D.C. and the U.S. Virgin Islands , how many senators are there in the U.S. Senate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 100

questions.question: Depending on the species, male deer are called all of these except one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Does

questions.question: A cows only sweat glands are located in this organ.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nose

questions.question: Is there a difference between a ram and a wether?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What does a Mohel do ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Perform circumcisions

questions.question: John Forbes Nash, the anti-hero of A Beautiful Mind , won the Nobel Prize in Mathematics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Criticisms of the F-15s close combat maneuverability, large size and this major factor, led to the development of the F-16, an airplane that complements the F-15 by having strengths in those areas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cost

questions.question: Who was the Pope before Pope John XXIII ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pius XII

questions.question: What color is the black box on an airplane ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: orange

questions.question: The horns of these animals consist of keratin, densely compacted hair.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhinos

questions.question: An elephants tusks are actually its horns.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the plural of  the word genus, coined by Carl Linnaeus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: genera

questions.question: What does the study of pistology focus on?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Faith

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Michael and Number
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, actor, players. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Choose the correct spelling for a noun meaning strict attention to minute details.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: meticulosity

questions.question: This actor shares the same birthday with his second wife, Catherine - September 25th. However, he is 25 years older than her.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Douglas

questions.question: This Michael has sold over 170 million albums worldwide.  He is the godfather of the Bee Gees frontmans son Michael Gibb.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Jackson

questions.question: One of these statements concerning giraffes is wrong.

options.text: Giraffes have only seven vertebrae in their neck.
Giraffes can run at speeds of up to 50kph.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giraffes always sleep upright.

questions.question: This Michael acts and finished Culinary School of America while working as a chef before becoming a model. He also appeared in Japanese commercials.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Pare

questions.question: In 1996 this Michael was chosen as one of the 50 greatest players of all time and then in 1999 ESPN voted him as the greatest athlete of the twentieth century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Jordan

questions.question: This Michael is nicknamed The Big Man.  Although he is a film director, he proved to be a very good writer. His book Stupid White Men...and Other Sorry Excuses for the State of the Nation reached number 1 on the New York Times non-fiction list.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Moore

questions.question: This American singer and song-writer has sold over 52 million albums and singles worldwide. He is mostly known for singing other artists songs, but he has written songs for  Barbra Streisand, KISS, Kenny Rogers, Kenny G, Cher, etc.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Bolton

questions.question: This Michael made his career as a football player for Liverpool. He was named European Footballer of the Year in December 2001.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Owen

questions.question: This Michael is a member of the Monty Python comedy group. He was named a Commander of the Order of British Empire by Queen Elizabeth II.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Palin

questions.question: This is the number of teats for milking that a goat has.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: In the case of this pop singer the name Michael is an artificial one.  His original name is Georgios Kyriacos Panayiotou. He was the first ever white male artist to record with Aretha Franklyn.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Michael

questions.question: This is the largest terrestrial mammal in North America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: American Bison

questions.question: Which is the correct spelling for an adjective meaning grossly irreverent toward what is or is held to be sacred?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sacrilegious

questions.question: This famous sporty Michael weighed 200 pounds when he was 13.  He was the prototype of the character Blood from Vendetta (1991).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Tyson

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Word and Note
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This word is defined as a stone coffin, often inscribed or decorated with sculpture.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sarcophagus

questions.question: Which actor does not portray a Taylor son on Home Improvement?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jake Thomas

questions.question: Which actress doesnt belong with the Brady clan? Heres a story of a lovely lady, who was bringing up three very lovely girls, all of them had hair of gold, like their mother, the youngest one in curls
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ashley Johnson

questions.question: In music this term refers to an embellishing note, usually one step above or below the note it precedes and indicated by a small note or special sign.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: appoggiatura

questions.question: Which term means a noncontagious inflammation of the skin, characterized chiefly by redness, itching, and the outbreak of lesions that may discharge serous matter and become encrusted and scaly.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: eczema

questions.question: Debuted in the 1979 remake of the movie The Champ. He became well-known as the star of Silver Spoons.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ricky Schroder

questions.question: Choose the proper spelling for the word which means an abnormal yellow discoloration of the skin often observed in cancerous tumors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: xanthosis

questions.question: This word is used to denote a Japanese pilot trained in World War II to make a suicidal crash attack, especially upon a ship.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: kamikaze

questions.question: This word is defined as a medication that reduces fever.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: antipyretic

questions.question: One of his first appearances was in Lucas, alongside Charlie Sheen. In 2001, he auctioned one of his teeth and clumps of his hair on eBay.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Corey Haim

questions.question: This adjective means capable of being understood or comprehended.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: intelligible

questions.question: An actor, film director and producer, he has starred in popular sitcoms.  His brother often has a cameo in the movies he directs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron Howard

questions.question: Name the word which refers to any of a group of green pigments that are found in the chloroplasts of plants and in other photosynthetic organisms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: chlorophyll

questions.question: Born February 22, 1975, she shot to fame when she co-starred in  E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drew Barrymore

questions.question: Died at age 23 from a drug overdose in a Hollywood night club outside the Viper Room.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: River Phoenix

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Actor and Canada
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, mohawk. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This actor, born in Vancouver, Canada, is famous for the role of Pacey Witter in the TV series, Dawsons Creek.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joshua Jackson

questions.question: This Canadian comedian, who hosted the ABC Comedy Hour in 1972, is best known for his celebrity impersonations.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rich Little

questions.question: In a haunting film starring this stunning beauty, her husband -- a pianist, progressively makes her feel she is going insane, by walking around in the attic of their house. The role won her an Oscar.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ingrid Berman

questions.question: Who said this memorable movie line: You know how to whistle dont you Steve?-- Just put your lips together and blow.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lauren Bacall

questions.question: Known for his work on many movies, such as  The Women, Gaslight, and My Fair lady, this director is well known for being fired from Gone With The Wind.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Cukor

questions.question: Spencer Tracy and Katharine Hepburn were one of Hollywoods best known couples. How many movies did this couple do together?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9

questions.question: This Canadian-born actor, singer and sportscaster, who received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 1973, was the host of the long-running game show Lets Make a Deal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monty Hall

questions.question: In 2005, this Toronto-born actor, who appeared in the TV series SCTV, released an album entitled, The Agoraphobic Cowboy, featuring country songs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rick Moranis

questions.question: This Canadian Mohawk Indian actor, who was inducted into the Western Performers Hall of Fame in 1993, is best known for his many appearances as the Lone Rangers friend, Tonto.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jay Silverheels

questions.question: This siren, known for wearing mens clothes, studied to be a violinist until a wrist injury caused her to switch to acting.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marlene Dietrich

questions.question: This Canadian-American actor is best known for his slapstick performances in comedy films, such as The Mask and Liar, Liar.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Carrey

questions.question: This Canadian actor, who started his career as a radio broadcaster, got the nickname The Voice of Doom because he delivered distressing war news during World War II.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lorne Greene

questions.question: The movie line, Im ready for my closeup Mr. De Mille was spoken by this actress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gloria Swanson

questions.question: This stage and film actor, born in London, Ontario, Canada, starred in Alfred Hitchcocks movie, Shadow of a Doubt.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hume Cronyn

questions.question: The Academy did not acknowledge this tall, dark and handsome actor until 1970, but Hitchcock adored him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cary Grant
